trans-unit.source: Head-related transfer function (HRTF) audio
trans-unit.target: Head-related transfer function (HRTF) audio

trans-unit.source: Head-related transfer function (HRTF) is an advanced way of rendering audio so that sounds appear to come from a specific point in 3D space, synthesizing binaural audio. It provides more realistic audio than standard spatialized audio. For example, with HRTF, the player can hear whether a character is above or below them. This is particularly useful for VR applications, as it increases immersion.
trans-unit.target: Head-related transfer function (HRTF) is an advanced way of rendering audio so that sounds appear to come from a specific point in 3D space, synthesizing binaural audio. It provides more realistic audio than standard spatialized audio. For example, with HRTF, the player can hear whether a character is above or below them. This is particularly useful for VR applications, as it increases immersion.

trans-unit.source: Players don't need special hardware to use HRTF. However, the effect works much better with headphones than speakers.
trans-unit.target: Players don't need special hardware to use HRTF. However, the effect works much better with headphones than speakers.

trans-unit.source: This video demonstrates the effect of HRTF audio:
trans-unit.target: This video demonstrates the effect of HRTF audio:

trans-unit.source: !Note For now, you can only use HRTF on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: !Note For now, you can only use HRTF on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Enable HRTF
trans-unit.target: Enable HRTF

trans-unit.source: To use HRTF, first enable it globally in the Game Settings asset, then enable HRTF on the entities you want to use it with.
trans-unit.target: To use HRTF, first enable it globally in the Game Settings asset, then enable HRTF on the entities you want to use it with.

trans-unit.source: 1. Enable HRTF globally
trans-unit.target: 1. Enable HRTF globally

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer (the bottom-left pane by default), select the Assets folder.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer (the bottom-left pane by default), select the Assets folder.

trans-unit.source: Select Assets folder asset
trans-unit.target: Select Assets folder asset

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (the bottom pane by default), select the GameSettings asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (the bottom pane by default), select the GameSettings asset.

trans-unit.source: Select Game Settings asset
trans-unit.target: Select Game Settings asset

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (the right-hand pane by default), under Audio settings, select HRTF support.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (the right-hand pane by default), under Audio settings, select HRTF support.

trans-unit.source: Audio settings
trans-unit.target: Audio settings

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Game Settings asset, see Game settings.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Game Settings asset, see Game settings.

trans-unit.source: 2. Enable HRTF on the entities
trans-unit.target: 2. Enable HRTF on the entities

trans-unit.source: Select the entity with the audio emitter that contains the sound you want to enable for HRTF.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity with the audio emitter that contains the sound you want to enable for HRTF.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), under Audio emitter, select Use HRTF.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), under Audio emitter, select Use HRTF.

trans-unit.source: Audio emitter properties
trans-unit.target: Audio emitter properties

trans-unit.source: Sounds emitted from this entity will use HRTF.
trans-unit.target: Sounds emitted from this entity will use HRTF.

trans-unit.source: !Note The HRTF option applies to every sound emitted from this audio emitter.
trans-unit.target: !Note The HRTF option applies to every sound emitted from this audio emitter.

trans-unit.source: For more information about audio emitters, including the properties you can change, see Audio emitters.
trans-unit.target: For more information about audio emitters, including the properties you can change, see Audio emitters.
